intro: Zwaardekronia lurida, commonly known as the pale ghost orchid, is a rare and enigmatic orchid species native to specific regions of South Africa. It is characterized by its delicate, pale greenish-yellow flowers and slender, often hairless stems. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in shaded or semi-shaded environments. Its unique morphology and limited distribution make it a subject of interest for botanists and conservationists. Due to habitat loss and over-collection, Zwaardekronia lurida is considered endangered, highlighting the need for its protection.
